pageTitle: Food Service Sales in Convenience Stores: Shelf-Stable Products Data 2014 | CSPnet
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {54898=The top selling c-store brand of soup in 2013 by dollars was Nissin Cup Noodles ramen, with the Nissin Top Ramen Oodles of Noodles ramen the biggest seller by units, according to IRI., 48633=C-store sales, 52 weeks ending Dec. 29, 2013}
textBeforeTable: In the dry-grocery aisle, c-store sales were a mixed bag. The largest segment—cold cereal—saw dollar sales off more than 4%, according to IRI and Nielsen. Sales of coffee rose nearly 12%, according to IRI, with units up just over 2%. Sales of condiments—pickles, mustard, etc.—were modest overall. C-store sales, 52 weeks ending Dec. 29, 2013 Where the Gains Are Article Preview:  1/31/2014 Soup Makes Comeback Across Foodservice Channels 5/10/2013 Packaged Food/Foodservice: Shelf Stable 2013 Related Content Foodservice: Shelf-Stable Products 2014 CSP Special Issue (CMH) | April 2014 //--> OAS_AD("x26"); OAS_AD("x06");
textAfterTable: Source: IRI Soup by Dollars and Units C-store sales, 52 weeks ending Dec. 29, 2013 The top selling c-store brand of soup in 2013 by dollars was Nissin Cup Noodles ramen, with the Nissin Top Ramen Oodles of Noodles ramen the biggest seller by units, according to IRI.
